title: Portal del Priorat 2013 Negre De Negres Red (Priorat)
description: Rubber, Band-Aid and leathery red-fruit aromas open this blend of Garnacha, Carignan and Syrah. In the mouth, this is blocky and collapsed. Roasted plum and berry flavors carry a medicinal note, while this is chewy and tastes lightly herbal on a tannic, weighty finish.

title: Quercia al Poggio 2010 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely from organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with blackberry, leather and baking spice notes. The concentrated palate delivers mature black plum, espresso, toast and tobacco flavors, bolstered by astringent tannins that grip the finish.

title: Piaggia 2013 Riserva  (Carmignano)
description: Dark-skinned berry, leather and underbrush aromas come together in this blend of 70% Sangiovese, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Merlot. The dense palate doles out black plum, clove and toast flavors, supported by dusty, assertive tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: La Poderina 2010 Poggio Abate Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: This opens with subdued berry and carob aromas. The dense palate delivers ripe black cherry, mocha and tobacco flavors, framed by rounded tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: Avignonesi 2015  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Tilled soil, blue flower and Mediterranean herb aromas follow through to the young, tightly wound palate. Juicy dark-skinned berry flavor is supported by taut, fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2018.

title: Badia di Morrona 2011 Vigna Alta Sangiovese (Toscana)
description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this opens with delicate black-skinned fruit and baking spice aromas. The straightforward palate delivers black cherry jam, cooking spice and white pepper flavors, rounded with ripe tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Château Marsau 2016 Barrel Sample  (Côtes de Bordeaux Francs)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is richly spicy and refreshingly juicy. Fine tannins give the wine its structure while leaving the beautiful fruit right up front. This will be ready from 2025.

title: Château Pindefleurs 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Ripe and spicy with rich berry fruits to balance generous tannins, this wine is dark and firm. It has the potential for some good medium-term aging over 10 years.

title: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is fresh and crisp as much as sweet. It has attractive acidity and light a botrytis character. It is suited for medium-term enjoyment.

title: Château Souverain 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Jammy fruit aromas and flavors and a lack of overt oak notes make this full-bodied wine easy to love. It's simply yummy in flavor, polished in texture, and has a nice, lingering ripe fruit finish.

title: Ciacci Piccolomini d'Aragona 2013 Ateo Red (Sant'Antimo)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this opens with black cherry and cinnamon aromas that carry over to the straightforward, balsamic-seeming palate. Polished tannins provide support. Drink through 2020.

title: Citille di Sopra 2015  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This opens with violet, red berry and leather aromas. The savory, straightforward palate offers ripe red cherry, raspberry and clove notes, with a hint of sage and fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Clos Vieux Taillefer 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. The tannins currently dominate this dense wine. It has a juicy element at the back that should be enough to give the wine balance as it develops. But the hard, dry tannins need to be tamed.

title: Corte Pavone 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this evokes mature black-skinned fruit, leather and forest floor aromas. It's warm and densely concentrated on the palate; fleshy black plum, tobacco and aniseed flavors leave it feeling one-dimensional. Drink 2018–2022.

title: Crocedimezzo 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Delicate wild berry, underbrush, clove and grilled herb scents waft from the glass. The palate is ethereal and light-bodied, offering red cherry, pomegranate, and cinnamon flavors with a touch of game. Tangy acidity and supple tannins make it approachable now. Drink through 2020.

title: De Tierra 2015 Zabala Vineyard Riesling (Arroyo Seco)
description: The nose of this bottling from a stone-strewn vineyard in the heart of the appellation is very restrained, offering wet concrete, lime and lemon pith scents, with a touch of sweet chive. Pink grapefruit and petrol notes show on the palate, which is layered with an intriguingly sticky texture.

title: Dei 2011 Bossona Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Stewed prune, espresso, and menthol aromas lead the nose, along with a whiff of leather. The warm, robust palate offers raisin, clove and licorice flavors, while fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2019.

title: Domaine Charles Baur 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The nose is very shy: a mere hint of earthiness emanates. The slender palate shows very clean fruit of yellow apple residing on a slender lemony palate. This is fresh and sprightly with a dry finish. Drink soon.

title: Château Croix de Labrie 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This is a ripe, juicy wine. It has a core of tannins but they are submerged by the generous black fruits and acidity. It is dense on the palate, but with an essential crispness on the close.

title: Château des Annereaux 2016 Barrel Sample  (Lalande de Pomerol)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This Merlot-dominated wine has notes of spice and juicy blackberry, framed by generous tannins. It is not a wine for long-term aging, though within 10 years it will be a pleasure.

title: Château du Cartillon 2016 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is dry and firm. There is an indication of black fruit which needs to develop further. Because the wine has weight, it will eventually become rich and concentrated, worthy of medium-term aging.

title: Château Labat 2016 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This is a firm and dense wine, with solid tannins and rich black-fruit tones. Thanks to its generosity and concentration, it should age well.

title: Basagoiti 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spicy reedy cherry and red-plum aromas open this high-acid sizzler from a cool vintage. Lean as a stick in terms of build, this tastes of raspberry, red plum and dry spices. A short but juicy and tight finish is ripping with acid. Drink through 2025.

title: Biondi Santi 2014 Fascia Rossa  (Rosso di Montalcino)
description: Due to the cold, wet vintage, the estate made no Brunello in 2014; its best grapes went into this wine. It shows the house's hallmark elegance and is delicately scented with bright red berry and violet aromas that carry over to the ethereal palate, accented by a white pepper note. Racy acidity and tight, fine tannins provide the framework. Drink 2018–2024.

title: Brazin 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Potent oaky aromas like nutmeg, cinnamon and toasted baguette meet abundant, jammy fruit flavors in this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It has moderate tannins that provide nice grip and shore up the oak and fruit components for balance.

title: Carabella 2014 Inchinnan Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This is indicated as a reserve-level selection, but at the moment remains unfocused, and even a bit dilute. Tart fruits and tight tannins never quite fit together. The drying finish carries a hint of wet cement. Give this at least another year or two of bottle age.

title: Carpineto 2012 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Subtle plum, toast, underbrush and violet aromas slowly emerge in this Riserva. The firm palate offers black currant, sour cherry, dried sage and espresso, while taut, close-grained tannins leave an assertive finish. Drink 2018–2023.

title: Joseph Cattin 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A distinct aromatic notion of rose petals perfumes the nose. The palate is more in keeping with Pinot Blanc's more restrained nature but is light, fresh and appetizing.

title: Julia James 2015 Pinot Noir (California)
description: alance, ripe fruit and a dash of cinnamon make this wine easy to appreciate and fun to drink in light of its reasonable price. It has medium body, plum and red cherry notes and a hint of spicy oak.

title: Michele Satta 2015 Rosato Red (Bolgheri)
description: Made predominantly from Sangiovese, the balance in Syrah and Merlot, this opens with red cherry and Mediterranean herb aromas. The palate is vibrant with raspberry, red currant and white pepper flavors, tempered by crisp acidity. Enjoy soon to capture the juicy fruit.
